content: In terms of revenues, Maestro's annual revenues are currently approximately $19 million compared to our trailing 12 months of $22 million or so. But from our perspective, the bottom line is this, that we're getting $15.79 million in cash, 80 customers do 25,000 employee lives and 2 strategic products, and our purchase price of $22.1 million is financed over 4 years by the seller at 10% interest. Our cost of revenue for Q2, excluding depreciation and amortization, were approximately $4.2 million or 75% of revenues compared to 73% of revenues for the first quarter. Our second quarter operating expenses, not including cost of revenues, depreciation and amortization and stock-based compensation, increased by approximately $500,000 compared to the first quarter. Excluding stock-based compensation of $1.1 million and depreciation and amortization and asset write-off expenses of $776,000, adjusted EBITDA for the second quarter was a negative of approximately $4.7 million compared to a negative of $4 million in the first quarter.
